newsitem.title: UK: Lasmo up as Merrill raises to "accumulate".
newsitem.headline: Lasmo up as Merrill raises to "accumulate".

text.p: Shares in Lasmo Plc gained on Monday as the oil stock was raised to "accumulate" from "neutral" at Merrill Lynch, traders said.
The stock was up 8p at 212-1/2 by 0922 GMT -- after touching a year's high of 214p --in active trade of 2.1 million shares.
In a 50-page report, Merrill analysts said they were positive on the stock for reasons beyond its expected gains from a rising oil price.

They said Lasmo was one of the most leveraged stocks to the price of oil -- every $1 rise above its assumed 1997 average oil price of $17.90 would raise the company's earnings per share by 25 percent -- but the upgrade was mainly for other reasons.
Merrill analyst John Wright said the brokerage listed four reasons for turning more positive on the stock -- ranging from the company's management strength to its promising exploration resources.
After extensive restructuring and asset sales in recent years it was a "much more focused company" he said, "it has built a stable platform and has started to expand its exploration expenditure."
He said there was upside on top of Merrill's conservative valuation on the stock of 213p, and it could rise as high as 250p through the next 12 months.
